briefTitle: Observational, Multi-Center Study of the Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C in the Russian Federation
officialTitle: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C in the Russian Federation - An Observational, Multi-Center Study

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Patients are eligible for observation in this cohort if the following applies:

* Treatment-naïve or -experienced adult male or female patients with confirmed chronic hepatitis C, genotype 1, receiving combination therapy with paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label
* If RBV is co-administered with paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir, it has been prescribed in line with the current local label (with special attention to contraception requirements and contraindication during pregnancy)
* Patients must voluntarily sign and date informed consent prior to inclusion into the study

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient must not be participating or intending to participate in a concurrent interventional therapeutic trial

primary.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-Treatment (SVR12)
primary.description: SVR12 is defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels \< 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last actual dose of paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir, ± dasabuvir, ± RBV.
primary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants Meeting SVR12 Non-Response Categories of Breakthrough, Failure to Suppress, and/or Relapse
secondary.description: Breakthrough is defined as at least 1 documented HCV RNA \<50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥50 IU/mL during treatment. Failure to suppress is defined as each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL. Relapse is defined as HCV RNA \< 50 IU/mL at end of treatment or at the last on-treatment HCV RNA measurement followed by HCV RNA ≧ 50 IU/mL posttreatment.
secondary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Breakthrough
secondary.description: Breakthrough is defined as at least 1 documented HCV RNA \<50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥50 IU/mL during treatment.
secondary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Failure to Suppress
secondary.description: Failure to suppress is defined as each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL.
secondary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Relapse
secondary.description: Relapse is defined as HCV RNA \<50 IU/mL at EoT or at the last on-treatment HCV RNA measurement followed by HCV RNA ≧ 50 IU/mL posttreatment.
secondary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Premature Study Drug Discontinuation With No On-Treatment Virologic Failure
secondary.description: On-treatment virologic failure included virological breakthrough and failure to suppress. Virological breakthrough was defined as at least one documented HCV RNA \< 50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL during treatment. Failure to suppress was defined as each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL or positive.
secondary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Missing SVR12 Data
secondary.timeFrame: 12 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virologic Response 24 Weeks Post-Treatment (SVR24)
secondary.description: SVR24 is defined as HCV RNA levels \< 50 IU/mL 24 weeks after the last actual dose of paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir, ± dasabuvir, ± RBV.
secondary.timeFrame: 24 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Virological Response at End of Treatment
secondary.description: Virologic response is defined as HCV RNA \< 50 IU/mL.
secondary.timeFrame: From baseline until end of treatment (12 or 24 weeks after actual first dose)

other.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving SVR12: Additional Analysis
other.description: SVR12 is defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels \< 50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative 12 weeks after the last actual dose of paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir, ± dasabuvir, ± RBV.
other.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

other.measure: Percentage of Participants Meeting SVR12 Non-Response Categories of Breakthrough, Failure to Suppress, and/or Relapse: Additional Analysis
other.description: Breakthrough is defined as at least 1 documented HCV RNA \<50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative followed by HCV RNA ≥50 IU/mL or positive during treatment. Failure to suppress is defined as each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL or positive. Relapse is defined as HCV RNA \< 50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative at end of treatment or at the last on-treatment HCV RNA measurement followed by HCV RNA ≧ 50 IU/mL or positive posttreatment.
other.timeFrame: 12 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

other.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Breakthrough: Additional Analysis
other.description: Breakthrough is defined as at least 1 documented HCV RNA \<50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative followed by HCV RNA ≥50 IU/mL or positive during treatment.
other.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

other.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Failure to Suppress: Additional Analysis
other.description: Failure to suppress is defined as each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL or positive.
other.timeFrame: 12 weeks after the last actual dose of study drug

other.measure: SVR12 Non-Response: Percentage of Participants With Relapse: Additional Analysis
other.description: Relapse is defined as HCV RNA \< 50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative at end of treatment or at the last on-treatment HCV RNA measurement followed by HCV RNA ≧ 50 IU/mL or positive posttreatment.
other.timeFrame: 12 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

other.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving SVR24: Additional Analysis
other.description: SVR24 is defined as HCV RNA levels \< 50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative 24 weeks after the last actual dose of paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir, ± dasabuvir, ± RBV.
other.timeFrame: 24 weeks after last actual dose of study drug

other.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Virological Response at End of Treatment: Additional Analysis
other.description: Virologic response is defined as HCV RNA \< 50 IU/mL or undetectable/negative.
other.timeFrame: From baseline until end of treatment (12 or 24 weeks after actual first dose)
